title: I really think that the champion grading tool is to much role based.
body:
I have been really trying my hardest to just get that last S recently for my favorite champ Twitch. The thing that I discovered is that I think it is to much role based. 
I want you to geuss what grade these games are- 
https://app.blitz.gg/lol/match/na1/JustifiedkNot/2846740648
https://app.blitz.gg/lol/match/na1/JustifiedkNot/2846382868
Usually I do not complain about the grading system, but I just think it is to biased on cs on ADC. I wanted to play more objectively and not just afk farm.
I do not even think it factors in the enemy lane opponent.

The first game was graded, A+ 
The second game was graded, A+

I also recall my support getting a S+
My Darius getting an S
and my Zoe getting an S-

Like what is that grading?

replies.body: Pretty sure the grading system is based on how other people do on the same champ in the same position. Not sure what they include in the score, but it's definitely comparing you to others in the same role. To this day though I still can't figure out what counts. CS? Vision score? CC? Tower kills? The world may never know.

> [{quoted}](name=theChibiTina,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jQXhGcgc,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-08-15T10:42:31.287+0000)

Not sure what they include in the score, but it's definitely comparing you to others in the same role. To this day though I still can't figure out what counts. CS? Vision score? CC? Tower kills? The world may never know.

It isn't like my CS was bad. It is actually the average CS per min for the champ.
To get an easier S-rank, play the champ in an off role. Like I easily get S for going Garen jungle with a quite average performance
I don’t know why they encourage csing in the corner over say objectives or kill involvement and securing
